articles.title: "Over A Billion Indians...": Centre Counters Moody's Aadhaar Criticism - NDTV
articles.description: Responding to global credit agency Moody's claims that Aadhaar poses privacy and security risks, and the use of its biometric technology in humid climates is unreliable, Centre on Monday termed the assertions baseless and lacking evidence.
articles.content:
The Centre said global bodies like the IMF and the World Bank have praised Aadhaar.

articles.title: US-China rivalry spurs investment in space tech - BBC
articles.description: The race to get back to the moon is fuelling US investment in private sector space firms.
articles.content:
The US is "in a space race with China to go back to the moon", says Nasa chief Bill Nelson.
In a BBC interview, Mr Nelson says he wants to make sure "we get there first".

articles.description: Breathing exercises are a key component of maintaining healthy lungs. This article introduces five effective breathing exercises that can enhance lung capacity and efficiency. Techniques like diaphragmatic breathing, pursed-lip breathing, alternate nostril br…
articles.content: Diaphragmatic breathing focuses on engaging your diaphragm to promote efficient oxygen exchange in the lungs. To practice this exercise, first find a quiet, comfortable space to sit or lie down. Posi… [+364 chars]

articles.description: Huawei teases new luxury smartphone and launches a new gold-inlaid smartwatch but makes no comment on the chip behind its Mate 60 Pro handset.

articles.title: Apple iPhone 15 got off to a hot start, but there was a bug, says Mark Gurman - HT Tech
articles.description: iPhone 15 users are running into a new bug during the initial setup process that is rendering their devices inoperable, but Apple has already rolled out a fix for it, according to Bloomberg’s Mark Gurman.
